articles.title: 407-Million-Year-Old Fossil Overturns Thinking on Evolution of Leafy Plants - Sci.News
articles.description: Reconstructing the Early Devonian clubmoss Asteroxylon mackiei, paleontologists found alternative leaf arrangements suggesting that Fibonacci-style patterning was not ancestral to living land plants.
articles.content: Aerial parts of plants arrange their organs around stems, and this arrangement defines their structure. In most existing plant species, organs emerge at 137.5 degrees from the previous organ. This re… [+3278 chars]

articles.title: Bear that looked like a raccoon, had a lethal appetite - DTNEXT
articles.description: Paleontologists excavated the fossil of the bear in 1982.
articles.content: Some 30 million years ago, a primitive bear roamed near a river in what is now North Dakota. A male, he probably looked like a raccoon and might have eaten like an otter. An inspection of the curious… [+2907 chars]
